dc:title: Florence Is A Communist
dc:creator: Dorothy Day
dc:description: Lauds the courage of a Southern household maid who became a Communist hoping for a better social order. Notes the degradation of cottons workers and prods Catholics to become lay apostles to help build up a new social order.
